# palette

`palette` provides a lightweight infrastructure for working with color
palettes in R. The primary goal is to place colors directly next to
their character representations. To do this, we create a palette class
based on [`vctrs`](https://vctrs.r-lib.org/index.html). We then provide
methods for this class, including
[`print()`](https://rdrr.io/r/base/print.html),
[`plot()`](https://rdrr.io/r/graphics/plot.default.html), and
[`pillar`](https://pillar.r-lib.org/). To keep it lightweight and usable
in other packages, the only direct dependencies are `vctrs`, `cli`, and
`pillar`.

## Installation

You can install the development version of palette from
[GitHub](https://github.com/) with:

``` r
# install.packages('pak')
pak::pak('christopherkenny/palette')
```

## Using `palette`

`palette` primarily provides a `palette` `vctrs` class. Using included
data, `roygbiv`, a length 7 vector of hex codes, we can create a
palette.

``` r
library(palette)
#> 
#> Attaching package: 'palette'
#> The following object is masked from 'package:grDevices':
#> 
#>     palette
palette(roygbiv)
```

![](reference/figures/README-print.png)

  
  
  
  

There is also a [`plot()`](https://rdrr.io/r/graphics/plot.default.html)
method for visualizing the colors:

``` r
plot(palette(roygbiv))
```

![](reference/figures/README-plot-1.png)

For use within `tibble`s, there is a `pillar_shaft` method:

``` r
tibble::tibble(
  color = palette(roygbiv)
)
```

![](reference/figures/README-pillar.png)

# Package index

## The `palette` class

Creating and manipulating `palette`s

- [`palette()`](http://christophertkenny.com/palette/reference/palette.md)
  [`validate_palette()`](http://christophertkenny.com/palette/reference/palette.md)
  [`is_palette()`](http://christophertkenny.com/palette/reference/palette.md)
  [`as_palette()`](http://christophertkenny.com/palette/reference/palette.md)
  : Create a palette
- [`vec_ptype2(`*`<palette>`*`)`](http://christophertkenny.com/palette/reference/vec_ptype2.palette.md)
  : Palette Coercion
- [`darken()`](http://christophertkenny.com/palette/reference/brightness.md)
  [`lighten()`](http://christophertkenny.com/palette/reference/brightness.md)
  : Control palette brightness
- [`saturate()`](http://christophertkenny.com/palette/reference/saturation.md)
  [`desaturate()`](http://christophertkenny.com/palette/reference/saturation.md)
  : Control palette saturation

## Work with palette websites

Functions for viewing and decoding palettes from URLs

- [`palette_browse()`](http://christophertkenny.com/palette/reference/palette_browse.md)
  [`palette_browse_url()`](http://christophertkenny.com/palette/reference/palette_browse.md)
  : Browse a palette on coolors.co
- [`palette_decode_url()`](http://christophertkenny.com/palette/reference/palette_decode_url.md)
  : Convert a URL to a palette

## Helpers

Additional tools and example data

- [`palette_function()`](http://christophertkenny.com/palette/reference/palette_function.md)
  : Build a palette function
- [`plot_palette()`](http://christophertkenny.com/palette/reference/plot_palette.md)
  : Plot Palette Colors
- [`roygbiv`](http://christophertkenny.com/palette/reference/roygbiv.md)
  : Rainbow Colors
